p: Hepatitis B virus is an enveloped DNA virus that is a member of the Hepadnaviridae family. It has several important structures that include the surface antigen, the core antigen, and e antigen. Various tests have been developed to these different structures to help make a diagnosis of hepatitis B. Ten genotypes (A to J) and several subtypes have been described. Genotype A is prevalent in North America and Europe. The virus is transmitted predominantly by the parenteral route, sexual contact, and perinatal exposure [ 98].
